column4: Hey guys, trying to install Ubuntu on this computer, but when I boot the Ubuntu 10.10 CD I just made, it just takes me to a terminal that says something like "Unable to find a live image to boot to"
try to make another CD and if fails download a new copy
I have a limited number of CDs. You think the image corrupted somewhere?
I did. I got the exact same problem with it
do you want to use windows and ubuntu?
I also checked the hash of the iso, and it's correct
do you want to use windows and ubuntu?
I don't care. I'd be fine with just ubuntu
go to this and do it. http://en.gentoo-wiki.com/wiki/Initramfs#Basics
what is this, I don't even... I just want to boot into livecd, not create my own initramfs or whatever this is. Also, the initramfs does say it has BusyBox
initramfs is going to do what the kernel can't do like showing up boot screen and mounting specified root partition
initramfs is going to do what the kernel can't do like showing up boot screen and mounting specified root partition
so i guess creating a live file system is the job of initramfs rite?
I don't know what the job of the initramfs is. I'm a java programmer trying to get ubuntu running, this stuff confuses me >_<
ok, I'll try. And Java is just what I'm known best for. I know a dozen others too.
